[Bazaar Path.]

The going slows down briefly as someone stops dead in their tracks. Every so often one feels the need to take in the sounds and smells that are uniquely the Bazaar. Any slow down in the movement of the crowd creates a loud string of curses. The sellers are eager to get to market to get rid of their goods, and the buyers anticipate their purchases.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Bant north...

[Bazaar Path.]

A break in the traffic shows a small worn path that heads to the west. Many travel that way, sure of their ability to navigate the stalls and tents that create this market place. The larger carts and those not too sure of themselves continue to head north. A small shack sits on the eastern side of the road, its door hanging precariously on its hinges.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

You follow Bant west...

[Bazaar Path.]

Surrounded by stalls and people, the masses move towards the south. It is virtually impossible to find the small path that got you to this location in the first place. Only those with a working knowledge of the Bazaar can be lucky enough to find their way through it in a timely manner.  A wooden sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: south*.

You follow Bant south...

[The Bazaar.]

This is the eastern edge of the Bazaar. The various aromas are almost overpowering, the sights unbelievable, and the variety of exotic items unmatched by any place else in the world. The crowd presses in tightly making those who travel here very aware of the fact that taking your eyes off your destination will find you quickly lost.  A red and white applewood sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: south* northwest*.

You follow Bant northwest...

[Food Way.]

The heavy odor tickling your nose proclaims this the food section of the Bazaar. Foods native to every species can be found throughout the area. Many of the items are unique delicacies, not found anywhere else. A quick glance at a few of them and you are pretty certain you know why. A semi-permanent structure stands to the north of the path. A sign over the door announces the location as Gwollin's Brews.  An open faded walnut door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: southeast* west*.

You follow Bant west...

[Food Way.]

At this intersection many stands display their exotic foodstuffs. Hanging from large hooks are various unidentifiable hunks of meat, and vegetables of all shapes and colors. The only thing more prevalent than the merchants and buyers are the bugs, who clamor to find the most pungent item to land on. To the northeast a small tent can barely be seen hiding behind the stalls.  A white silk tent and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north east* south* west*.

You follow Bant south...

[The Bazaar.]

Moving into the heart of the Bazaar, you encounter a more established shop. The building is sturdier, and built for long term occupancy. The general store has a steady stream of customers, and it serves those young adventurers who are in need of supplies.  A weathered wooden sign, an open faded chestnut door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Bant south...

[The Bazaar.]

Guards stand before each stall at this intersection, on what has come to be known as Jeweler's Row. Crowds of customers vie for the finest stones and most beautiful gems. All different manner of merchants hawk their wares as those you should buy. Those who are not careful are just as liable to walk away with a sparkly piece of glass as an expensive diamond.  A bright vellum sign, an open stall, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.

You follow Bant south...

[The Bazaar.]

Standing on the western side of the road is a small stall filled with beakers and assorted philters. Exotic potions of both the mundane and magical variety are being offered for sale. Standing on either side of the stall door are two rather large Thugian guards, the merchant takes no chances with his special concoctions.  A sign, an open stall, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Bant south...

[The Bazaar.]

The well-defined Bazaar path heads off to the west. This corner is a mix of the old and the new. On one corner an old stall is barely standing. The roof has caved in, and it quickly becomes apparent that this location has become a local dump. Pieces of wood that look suspiciously like some of the leftovers from other construction sites are piled on top of rotting offal. On the opposite corner a new tent is being erected, its high roof and vivid coloring pleasing to the eye.  An open stall and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* west*.

You follow Bant west...

[The Bazaar.]

A long wooden stall is set here between the Bazaar path and the large barracks which house the Spurian guard. Hanging from the front of the rickety wooden roof are furs of every type. The merchant inside is rumored to give good prices for pelts, hides, and animal parts.  A tanned leather sign, an open sturdy fur-lined stall, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.

[The Bazaar.]

A new stall has been hastily constructed on this site, in the shadow of the large Spurian Wall. Most chose to build well within the Bazaar as opposed to this outer path. Low-grade wood and bent nails make up this sorry excuse for a business establishment. A small sign on the front has a crude picture of a key on it, and the name, "Skugz."  A crooked wooden sign, a weathered dark wooden stall, and a broken street lantern are here.

[Locksmith.]

A heavy odor of unwashed sweaty bodies assails you as you enter this rickety establishment. A short Go-blin-al scurries around in the shadows behind the counter. A variety of keys hang behind his counter, establishing this as a locksmith shop. He mumbles, as if to himself, "Heehee ... chests! Lots chests ... yeeees ... picky picky picky! Hee hee! Me unlock 'em, yeeees ... hee hee!"

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.

Genelyn flies down and lands.
Usage: SHOP <action>
 <action> = LIST <type>        -- display items available for sale.
            EXAMINE <item #>   -- examine one of those items.
            BUY <item #>       -- buy an item from the shopkeeper.
            HAGGLE BUY <item #>-- buy an item from the shopkeeper and haggle price.
            ADOPT <pet #>      -- buy a pet from the shopkeeper.
            APPRAISE <item>    -- ask the shopkeeper to appraise an item.
            SELL <item>        -- sell an item to the shopkeeper.
            HAGGLE SELL <item> -- sell an item to the shopkeeper and haggle price.
            REPAIR <item>      -- ask the shopkeeper to repair an item.
            BIND <item>        -- ask the shopkeeper to bind an item to you.
            UNLOCK <item>      -- ask the shopkeeper to unlock an item for you.
            TAILOR <item>      -- ask the shopkeeper to tailor an item to fit you.
            CLAIM              -- claim any items waiting for you.
            IMPLANT <rune>     -- have a rune implanted.
            RENEW <rune>       -- renew an existing rune.
            REMOVE <rune>      -- remove an existing rune.
            HEAL <hits>        -- pay for a healer to treat some of your damage.
            HEAL [ALL]         -- pay for a healer to treat all your wounds.
            RECOLOR <item>  -- ask the shopkeeper to recolor an item for you.
>
Bant just removed 32 silver coins from his open scorched steelwood box.

[Bazaar Path.]

Two large Oog-ra guards refuse to allow anyone to continue south. With loud gestures and over exaggerated pointing, they send wagons to the east or back north. With some slapping of backs, and happy grins, they congratulate themselves on following directions. A yell is heard from the south as Skugz screams, "Keep meee dooor clear...yes yeees...keep it clear." It is a wonder that he hasn't figured out they are turning away his customers.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* east*.

You follow Bant north...

[Bazaar Path.]

A slinky dressed female San Elf preens and giggles garnering the attention of several humans leaning out the window of the guards' quarters. Catcalls and whistles abound as she shows more thigh then is warranted. A wagon driver, distracted by the view, almost drives into a cart coming the opposite direction. Shouts are exchanged and fists shaken, as the San female snickers at all those involved.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Bant north...

[Bazaar Path.]

The foul odor of something that can be almost described as rotted corpses floats in from the east. You hear the cart drivers murmuring something about not eating the pressed cabbage, regardless of how good it tastes. They quickly point to the long line and the overflowing outhouse and wave their hands in front of their faces.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Bant north...

[Bazaar Path.]

Bazaar Path follows the line of the Spurian Wall. High above you can hear orders being barked and guards marching in rhythm. The closeness of the wall to the path has essentially blocked any breeze that might waft through the area. The stagnant air holds in the smells of food, incense and lots of bodies. It is not unusual to see the cart drivers with triangles of cloth pulled up over their nose and mouths.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* south*.

You follow Bant east...

[Bazaar Path.]

Several large carts head west, full of various items the owners are sure will sell for a decent profit. Empty carts, the sign of a prosperous day, head east. An old Thugian pulls and pushes a very stubborn donkey. Neither end seems to be cooperating with his demands. Two small children dance around the Thugian and the donkey, chanting and singing a nasty song. Quickly, he takes out a switch, which is enough encouragement for both the donkey to move and the children to run.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Bant east...

[Bazaar Path.]

The foot traffic on Bazaar Path turns south down a small trail into the heart of the Bazaar. Many of the smaller carts follow the buyers and merchants to avoid the conflicts with the larger wagons that continue west. The shouting up ahead quickens the pulse of even the most experienced seller.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* south west*.

You follow Bant east...

[Bazaar Path.]

Deep, muddy ruts mar the road. A trickle of water flows from an unknown source creating a horrid hazard. Drivers curse one another for holding up the flow of traffic. Merchants and buyers carefully pick their way around the hold up, attempting to carefully navigate the slippery ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Bant east...

[Bazaar Path.]

Bazaar Path makes a sudden left hand turn, following the direction of the large Spurian Wall. Carts and wagons creak in protest as their heavy loads shift precariously.  Waiting for that rare item to fall from one of the merchant carts, several small Flerian children play in the dust at the side of the road.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: south* west*.

[Bazaar Path.]

A break in the traffic shows a small worn path that heads to the west. Many travel that way, sure of their ability to navigate the stalls and tents that create this market place. The larger carts and those not too sure of themselves continue to head north. A small shack sits on the eastern side of the road, its door hanging precariously on its hinges.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

You follow Bant south...

[Bazaar Path.]

The going slows down briefly as someone stops dead in their tracks. Every so often one feels the need to take in the sounds and smells that are uniquely the Bazaar. Any slow down in the movement of the crowd creates a loud string of curses. The sellers are eager to get to market to get rid of their goods, and the buyers anticipate their purchases.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Bant south...

[Bazaar Path.]

The muffled noises you hear drifting in from the west come out of the Bazaar itself, a veritable hive of activity day and night. An occasion exotic smell is carried by the breeze to tantalize the nose. A large etched window displays tastefully dressed mannequins of many races.  An open sturdy mahogany door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Bant south...

[Bazaar Path.]

Further passage along Bazaar Path is blocked occasionally by brawling peasants. Fights break out over who got here first, who gets to sell first, whose goods are better and who should just pack up and leave. When guards are forced to leave their posts to settle the arguments, all involved lose.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Bant south...

[Bazaar Path.]

Many people crowd the narrow Bazaar Path, either heading towards the infamous Bazaar, or forcing their way back towards Trade Way. For a small price, a farmer can rent a booth and directly market his goods. Both some of the best and some of the worst deals can be made within this collection of stalls. The tall wall of Spur looms high to the east, and many of the guards take an early peek into the carts and the goods coming to market.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Bant south...

[Trade Way & Bazaar Path.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st stallion (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* east* west*.

You follow Bant west...

[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Bant west...

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

You follow Bant south...

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west. A shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

You follow Bant west...

[Side Street.]

A new building has been erected on this side street. It is sturdily constructed from wood and brick, and bears a sign reading, "Symher's Trading Post." Various objects line the window display ranging from weapons and armor to random objects you've never seen before. Insistent bartering goes on at all hours.  A pair of open double applewood doors and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st rosy-cheeked drunkard.
In the room are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious exits: east*.

You follow Bant through a pair of open double applewood doors...

[Spurian Trading Post.]

Symher the Usil Trader sits in a corner with a small lamp cataloging and appraising the various items he has deemed fit to buy.  The cluttered shelves are piled so high it's a wonder he can keep track.  You carefully make your way through the armor, weapons and assorted sundries, to the counter.  A pair of open double applewood doors are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Bant through an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door...

This room is illuminated.

[Trade Way.]

Many townsfolk pass along this busy thoroughfare. Rich and poor alike mix freely on this street, much to the dismay of a passing nobleman. A young human struggles with an armful of packages and two young children in tow. Those in need of goods or supplies head west towards the market, those looking for the news of the day head east towards Town Square.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Bant east...

[Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion.  Guards stand sentry from atop the wall as well as the ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: west*.

You follow Bant through an open stone gate...

[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A gilded oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east*.

You follow Bant east...

[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.


You follow Bant east...

[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Bant east...

[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Bant east...

[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious exits: east* west*.

You follow Bant east...

[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st thugian guard.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.

You follow Bant south...

[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them.  The door to the west has a freshly painted sign over it,  "Under New Management."  A closed tan weathered pine door, a large doorway, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southwest*.

You follow Bant southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Before you stands a magnificent white marble temple dedicated to Odarous, the god of chivalry. Ten giant steps made of the same gleaming marble lead up to the temple entrance. Two large statues stand at the base of the stairs, also carved of breath-taking marble. One is a warrior bearing a massive sword and a large shield. The other is a cleric with an amulet bearing the mark of Odarous in one hand and a large mace in the other.  Some gleaming white marble stairs, a polished white marble statue, a polished white marble statue, and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious exits: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Bant southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path heads out of the bustling Town Square and moves southwest towards the District of Magick and Rehas Way. Mixed with the robed mages that move southwest are merchants, customers and thieves alike. Moving quickly, especially with a full purse, is your best bet along this path.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Bant southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Several members of the various mage orders of Spur and well-dressed shoppers seeking rarities travel along Knowledge's Path to and from the District of Magick. The district is the place to find the most talented artisans and craftiest merchants in Spur. It is also home to the mages of the non-elemental order.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Bant southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

A heated discussion breaks out briefly between members of opposing orders of magick. The presence of the city guard rapidly brings an end to the exchange before the verbal debate over power and skill turns into a demonstration.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Bant southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path terminates here at the gateway to the Magick District. In respect to the demands of the various religious and guild leaders, magick is kept as far from them as possible. A city plagued by rioting mage haters is the last thing Spur needs.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: northeast*.

You follow Bant through an open stone gate...

[Magick Lane & Rehas Way.]

You are just inside the gateway between the Magick District and the Town Square. These gates stand open at all hours of the day or night. An otherwise unremarkable door is glorified by the sign of the city's healer posted beside it.  A wooden door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: south* west*.

You follow Bant south...

[Magick Lane.]

A massive circular stone platform stands to the side of Magick Lane, strangely entrancing runes carved on every inch of its sides. The symbol of the god Sa, a golden Dragon, fills the space along the top. Raw power and magick seem to flow from the platform, making the air around it crackle with energy. A small sign stands next to the platform with a single word written upon it.  A rune covered platform, a SIGN, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

>
You follow Bant south...

[Magick Lane.]

A low slung building resides on the west side of the street. Chanting can be heard from within.  Occasionally a few sparks rise into the sky, or some unwarranted raindrops begin, but they quickly are quelled. A large pair of wooden doors, their surface carved with rune symbols grace the entrance.  A street lantern and some open rune-etched wooden doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Bant south...

[Magick Lane.]

A squat ugly little shack stands somber on the eastern side of this well swept lane. A mysterious gothic structure rises from what was once scattered remains of an alchemy shop. A multi-colored stained glass window peers watchful from the crafty western building.  A rotting oak sign, a closed ugly rotting door, a closed arched rosewood gothic door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Bant south...

[Magick Lane.]

A small sign hangs from above the door of the well-kept store before you, telling you that it is a rune shop. The occasional bright flash of light from inside the store suggests all kinds of strange and rare magicks are being cast inside! Those who walk past you glance at the rune shop warily and hurry to get past it as quickly as possible. A small sign hangs from the doorknob of the store that reads "Flerians not allowed!"  An intricately carved oak door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Bant through an intricately carved oak door...

[Ragarn's Runes.]

Incredible images cover every free corner of this small store, pictures of every possible rune available for purchase hang from the ceiling, on the walls and some even sit on the floor. Drawn onto scrolls, carved into the wood finish of the building or crafted from any number of other materials, each of the different runes has its own strange feeling of excitement to it. The shop owner looks to know what every one of the runes does.  A large glowing sign, a wooden sign, an intricately carved oak door, and some flaming ruby ashes are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Town Square.]

Two elegant buildings, one to the north and one to the west, stand on either side of a quickly degrading road. Nattily dressed patrons of the two establishments hurry to their destination, not pausing for fear of being robbed, or worse. To the northwest the houses steadily become more decrepit. A dark pallor of smoky air hangs heavily over the area.  A street lantern and a heavy mahogany door are here.

This area is illuminated.

You follow Bant west...

[HOD Agent.]

You have entered the somber insurance headquarters of the House of the Dead. Richly appointed furnishings indicate that these services are refused by few. An elegant sign over a massive desk details available services. The presence of some inexplicable power sets your nerves on end. This is no place for hostility.   A wooden sign, a pitch black portal, and a pitch black portal are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Trade Way & Bazaar Path.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Bant west...

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

You follow Bant south...

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west. A shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

You follow Bant south...

[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Xavier the Human, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north*.

Xavier, moving in a determined manner, just went north.

You follow Bant through an archway...

[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Bant through an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door...

[Bank.]

The quiet hum of business fills your ears as you enter the Market Circle branch of the Rasnian Bank.  A long wooden desk at the far end of the room contains many tellers waiting to help you with your banking needs.  An open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door and a bright wooden sign are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian, Draffut the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north*.

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west. A shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Draffut the Drake, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

>[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

Gwen looks like a 1'5" standard young average boned, wirey-tough bodied Secian Cleric.
She has long, wild, fine coppery red hair, with triangular pale red eyes, and looks neat.
She appears to be happy right now.
She bears the mark of Elindale.
She can be attacked by other players.

On her back is a pair of small shimmering, iridescent turquoise wings. Tiny water droplets have beaded along the edges and reflect the light back in a rainbow brilliance.

On her right ankle is a tattoo of a tiny ivory unicorn with a turquoise horn. The unicorn's mane and tail are brilliantly colored with deep shades of blues and greens.

On her stomach, around the belly-button is a tattoo of a ring of mushrooms. The tiny ruby caps are dotted with turquoise spots. Peeking out from behind one is a bluish green wind faerie.

She appears to be in perfect health.

Physical appearance:

A small pixish face is surrounded by waves of bright red hair that flows down her back. Freckles dominate the bridge of her nose and spill onto her cheeks. Soft red eyes glow faintly in the light.

[Market Circle.]

What was once the notorious Spurian gambling hall has been completely remodeled and changed! Banners, ribbons and fliers hang all over the entire front of this massive building now thriving with business. A giant sign in red hangs down above the infamous oaken doors that reads, "Symher's Emporium", below the store name in small print a notice has been tacked on that reads, "We bring the savings to you!".  A pair of beautiful handmade mahogany doors are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Entrance, Symher's Emporium.]

Brilliant streamers hang festooned in deep swaths of velvet and bright multicolored bolts of silk over pearly white walls. Two circular glass enclosures rise some eight spans toward the ceiling on either side of the grand doors. Gentle tinkling music plays in the background as, within the cases, stunning garments of all types are lifted softly into magickal animation. According to the smiling Human attendant, their lovely lilting dance is but one of the many wonders that can be found within this shopping complex. Bright gauzy sleeves shift and undulate in the area to the east.  A pair of beautiful handmade mahogany doors are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west. A shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Gwen the Secian, Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Gwen the Secian, Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

You follow Bant west...

[Trade Way.]

The throngs of travelers thicken as one heads east along Trade Way. An Anthian plays softly on a strange looking stringed instrument, her melodic voice filling the air. Judging by her clothing, and the number of silvers at her feet, she makes a fine living practicing her craft.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Gwen the Secian, Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Bant west...

[Trade Way.]

Deep grey mists surround a strange pile of rubble that lies south of the road. Occasionally a priest clad in a simple grey robe will wander past the rubble and whisper a short prayer under his breath. The fence running around the rubble is well kept, but the gate which once allowed entrance to this Temple has been chained closed.  A grey iron chained gate, a pile of rubble, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Gwen the Secian, Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Bant west...

[Trade Way.]

From the city gate to the west, Trade Way continues eastward towards the busy Merchant district, past Joyeusse's Shop. The air is thick with the scent of fresh flowers. Wagons filled with goods bound for sale trundle past, their drivers hopeful of the anticipated profits. Eager young warriors venture towards the west gate and the dangers beyond.  An open carved rosewood door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Gwen the Secian, Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Bant west...

[Gateway.]

The relative safety inside Spur is a comfort to those returning from the fields and mountains. To those leaving, a massive wall of defense around the city lies ahead. Archer towers beside the gate overlook the wall, offering a painful welcome to would-be invaders. Several guards on foot patrol pass and disappear behind a thick, bluesteel banded steelwood door. Wall road stretches to the south, a wide passage between the city wall and several large buildings.  An open iron gate, an open thick stone door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Gwen the Secian, Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* south.

You follow Bant through an open iron gate...

The area brightens.
[Spur Gateway.]

Travelers from Rathan to the northwest, and the Trade Route to the south, converge at Spur's west gate. Guards posted on the ground give those seeking to enter the city a cursory once-over. Their lack of interest shows that anyone approaching has already been observed from above for some time. A grate in the ground loosens mud from wagon wheels and hooves before they pass through the gate, helping to keep the streets of Spur fairly clean.  An open giant black iron gate, a giant green oak tree, a small blue pool, a thick oak grate over the pool, and a polished stone marker are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Gwen the Secian, Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north south southwest west northwest.
You are not flying, how do you intend to do that?
>You are now following Draffut.

Bant is now following Draffut.

You follow Draffut north...

The area brightens.
[Oak Woods.]

Several maple trees grow near each other, surrounded by the tall oaks. Small birds call out bright songs, filling the air with their happy sounds. Tiny chipmunks scamper across the high branches.  A red maple tree is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Gwen the Secian, Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north south* southwest west northwest.

The area brightens.
[Oak Woods.]

Oak trees surround you on every side reaching their leaves up to the sky in majestic splendor. The call of the an owl causes the small creatures in the underbrush to scamper for safety. To the north a short, but steep, hill lies againt the huge city wall.  A light golden oak tree, a giant green oak tree, an open oak door, and an exposed giant pipe are here.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The path is flanked by countless tall oaks, swaying peacefully in the wind. They do their best to hide the sky from view, making it hard to tell night from day at times. Littering the area are pieces of broken wagon, bits of human remains and dried splotches of blood. The remnants of a violent fight lie all around you, whomever used to belong to the wagon is no more than vulture food.  A bloody severed foot is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east southeast* northwest.

[West Spur Road.]

This merchant road stretches southeasterly towards Spur and northerly towards distant mountain ranges and unknown lands beyond them. Travelers speak of many dangers to the north, and people heading that way must trust in their luck and skills.

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

A dark foreboding forest is visible far off to the west. No grass grows near the forest. The grasslands shrink away from the grove as if even the plant life is afraid of it. There is a barren area between where the grass ends and the trees begin, giving the forest the illusion of isolation.

A dark twisted forest lies to the west, breaking the tranquil feel of the grasslands. The trees that are visible are twisted and deformed, the ground is scorched and blackened. A heavy ground fog seeps from deep within the forest carrying with it the acrid smell of death.

[West Spur Road.]

To the southwest the ghostly outline of a forest can be seen darkening the area around it like a blight upon the land. Grassy plains stretch out to the west. Swarms of tiny insects hover just above the grass, in some places the swarms are so dense they take on the appearance of being a single entity.

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

Farm animals graze in the distance. Their vague forms barely visible as they lumber about the tall grass. To the north the flat grassland gives way to the rolling foothills of the Great Divide. The mountains themselves are nothing more than ghostly images fading in and out of view on the horizon.

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

A muddy pool of water lies to the north, nothing can be seen below its murky surface. The smell of rotting flesh rises from the pool and is carried for a great distance by the wind. The skeletal remains of what was once a cow lies half submerged in the water, its carcass picked clean by scavengers. 

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

A crumbling arch lies off the path to the east. It stands as the last reminder of an inn that once offered solace to the weary that traveled this path. It can be discerned from the blackened color of the arch that the inn was the unfortunate victim of a fire.

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The Silver River cuts through the grassland and heads southeast towards Spur. Fishing boats, bearing the crest of the of city of Spur, dart around several barges laden with exotic wares to trade in the merchant city. Most bear the livery of the city of Rathan, but every so often a ship flying unfamiliar colors can be sighted.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st foreign merchant, the 2nd foreign merchant, and the 3rd foreign merchant.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast southeast*.
[West Spur Road.]

The Silver River cuts through the grassland and heads southeast towards Spur. Fishing boats, bearing the crest of the of city of Spur, dart around several barges laden with exotic wares to trade in the merchant city. Most bear the livery of the city of Rathan, but every so often a ship flying unfamiliar colors can be sighted.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st foreign merchant, the 2nd foreign merchant, and the 3rd foreign merchant.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast southeast.
>
You follow Draffut northeast...


l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The western bank of the Silver River is composed of ankle-deep mud and slime the river washed upon the shore. A fish, that was unlucky enough to be swept ashore, flops itself about desperately trying to get back to the sanctuary of the water.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north southwest*.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The path is muddy and in some places the murky water is knee-deep. The Silver River is constantly overflowing as the muddy path clearly points out. The shape of a bridge crossing the river can be made out just in the distance to the northwest.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).

The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

The massive stone bridge expands over the Silver River. The river rushes past where the remains of the past bridge fill the water below. A fine misty spray splashes up and hits the jagged stone fragments.

The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

The bridge was built tall to allow the various merchant ships to pass under it. Its  height allows for a splendid view of the countryside, from Spur to the southeast, to the majestic peaks of the Great Divide.

l
The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

The river surges strongly below you. Even from this height the noise of the flowing water is near deafening. Two small fishing boats nearly collide as they try to pass between the same set of supports. Only skillful sailing prevents them from hitting each other, or the supports. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st ork.

l
The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

Extremely sturdy, though quickly rebuilt, the magnificent bridge spans across the mighty Silver River. Banners flutter in the breeze on both sides of the bridge, marking its reopening. Small gaps in the mortar are visible where the workers quickly pieced the stones together.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north south*.

Forsythia snickers quietly to herself.

l
The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

An osprey soars above the raging Silver River, scanning the water for a meal. Suddenly, it dives down to the surface and snatches a rather large trout from the water. The trout wriggles helplessly in the large birds grip as it is carried off on the western horizon.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).

The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

The massive stone bridge spans the mighty Silver River. The torrent of the river below rushes past the remains of the old bridge, carrying away bits of debris. Once heaping piles of building materials, now greatly dwindled lie discarded beside the bridge.  A broken wooden wagon is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The outline of a tall stone bridge can be made out to the southwest. The sound of flowing water roars loudly from that direction as well. Grassland is all that the eye can see in the immediate area to the northwest. Though the Great Divide is visible in the distance, its massive snow-covered peaks extending to the heavens, making everything else seem small in comparison. 

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).

[North Bridge Trail.]

Overflow from the nearby Silver River has turned much of the surrounding land into a muddy bog. Knee-deep and ice cold, the thick muddy water obscures the path from view.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Small patches of solid ground lie hidden by murky, leech-infested water. The ground beneath the surface of the bog is uneven and has a tendency to drop off sharply without warning.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A thin strip of solid ground cuts a precarious path through the center of the bog. Small bubbles of mud form just off the path, releasing noxious gasses as they burst. The mist thick cloud formed by the gas drops visibility to almost nothing.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A thick mist covers the ground, making it difficult to discern where solid footing lies. A large rock protrudes from the swampy water. Though shaped naturally, it could easily be mistaken for a dragon curled up in a comfortable sleep.

This area is illuminated.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Tall, wispy blades of grass sway in the gentle breeze. A lone tree stands out in the otherwise monotonous sea of green grass. The tall oak extends its branches over the path, offering shade and a place to rest for weary travellers.  An oak tree is here.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Two small bluebirds dart through the air. They take turns chasing each other, changing directions rapidly to avoid being caught. Eventually they tire of the game and fly off over the sea of grass.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Tall fields of grass cover the earth as far as the eye can see. The one exception is the travel-worn merchant road, which connects the city of Spur to the mountainous lands of the north. An occasional rustling can be heard just off the path as tiny creatures scurry about. 

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The rolling grasslands of the southwest merge seamlessly with the sloping hills of the east. The landscape gradually grows more rugged to the west, while endless grasslands are all the east reveals. 

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).

[North Bridge Trail.]

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

From all appearances, it looks like the road builders should have gone straight north, yet they didn't. It's almost as if they were blocked by something. The clump of trees to the north seems very thick, but that shouldn't have stopped determined builders. As you puzzle over the matter, you think you hear something calling you. You shake your head and move on.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).

[North Bridge Trail.]

From all appearances, it looks like the road builders should have gone straight north, yet they didn't. It's almost as if they were blocked by something. The clump of trees to the north seems very thick, but that shouldn't have stopped determined builders. As you puzzle over the matter, you think you hear something calling you. You shake your head and move on.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: northeast southeast.

[North Bridge Trail.]

A beggar lies here asking you to kindly spare him some food. By the looks of him, he hasn't shaved in months, and the smell of Dragon Ale hangs heavy in the air around him. Some stop and share a few silver with him, but most just wander past ignoring his loud request.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The road here forks in three directions. The area to the southeast seems to be more forested than where you are now. A small mountain of rock splits the two other paths to the west and northwest.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: southeast* west northwest.
[Tarath Bends.]

The road here forks in three directions. The area to the southeast seems to be more forested than where you are now. A small mountain of rock splits the two other paths to the west and northwest.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: southeast west northwest.
>
You follow Draffut northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Besides the rock wall that divides you from traveling anywhere but where the road leads you, the mountains give a very refreshing feeling as you travel them.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).

You follow Draffut west...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The path continues to twist and turn, seeming to dodge mounds of jagged rock and the occasional fresh-water stream.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The road makes a sharp switchback turn here. The view over the cliff to the west would be awe-inspiring if you didn't have the road's dangers constantly on your mind.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The path winds on. Voices of other travelers echo from far above, but the mountainside keeps you from seeing the road section they are on. It's hard to judge how long your remaining journey is.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The path curves back and forth in a very consistent and repetitive manner. The mountain air would be very refreshing, if it weren't for the lizardman overtones hanging in the air.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).

Gwen says to Draffut in Secian, "You're already at a disadvantage not being Turquoise an all"

You follow Draffut east...

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The path begins to straighten here, but up ahead you can see that it goes back to its twisting full force. Chips of limestone and other rock can be seen scattered all over the path.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A small stream runs across the path here. Some sticks have been laid across the streambed to act as a crude bridge, although they seem rickety at best. You feel it's safest to just jump across the stream.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The raw earth has been torn apart revealing a jagged crevice to the northwest. The floor of the crevice is littered with debris and slopes down into darkness. The crumbling edge of the east-west trail barely skirts the opening.

This area is illuminated.

You follow Draffut northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[Crumbling Fissure.]

The earth's upheaval has created this long and narrow fissure. The bottom of the gap is strewn with broken rock and the air hangs heavy with dust. Towering above you, the precarious walls shudder and occasionally drop a smattering of debris at your feet. 

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest.

You follow Draffut northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[Crumbling Fissure.]

The narrow fissure slopes upward and opens up to the northwest. Through the walls of the gap you can catch a slight glimpse of the mountain peaks above Rathan. A cold wind blows in from that direction, bringing with it the dusty smell of snow.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest.
[Crumbling Fissure.]

The narrow fissure slopes upward and opens up to the northwest. Through the walls of the gap you can catch a slight glimpse of the mountain peaks above Rathan. A cold wind blows in from that direction, bringing with it the dusty smell of snow.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: southeast northwest.
>
You follow Draffut northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Dust still hangs in the air over the narrow crevice that has opened up to the southeast. Above the crevice, the entire side of the mountain has broken away and fallen to the east. Giant boulders pockmark the way.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Old trees lay side by side with the massive boulders of the mountain, intermingling in a terrible landslide. The mountain top has broken off and slid across the eastern road stopping all forms of transportation. It would take years for mortal hands to remove the tons of stone from the original roadway to make it passable once again. Thankfully, nature has changed the landscape for the better, and has opened a gap through the mountain to the north.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).

[Tarath Gorge.]

Rough granite walls rise above you to the east and west. The area here is a bit rougher and seems to have been recently mined. Large veins of silver can be seen. The gorge seems just as large on both sides of you as it did when you first entered it. The sedimentary rock layers in the cliffsides dazzle you with the richness of their color. Looking closer, you see tracks running up to the gate of a massive fort.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: north south.
>
You follow Draffut north...


l
The area brightens.
[Fort Tarath.]

You stand before a granite wall and large double gated doors. The walls are thick and finely crafted, and there seems to be a rather aged look about them.  The Gate is made of massive slabs of silver, while off to the left and right are the fort's impressive walls, able to withstand a rather large invasion or army if need be.  An open silver-trimmed black drathain gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: south*.

Obvious paths: south.
>
You follow Draffut through an open silver-trimmed black drathain gate...


l
The area brightens.
[Fort Tarath.]

The giant fortification wall is divided into two main sections by huge doors.  These doors have been made from silver and look as though they could stand even the most fearsome battering ram.  Guards standing atop the walls eye you closely.  To the north you can see the business district.  An open silver-trimmed black drathain gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: north east west.

Forsythia says to Gwen in Secian, "Oh. I was just beginning my rudeness early on with that one."

You follow Draffut north...


l
The area brightens.
[Fort Tarath.]

Each corner of this square gives entrance to one of the fort's four business establishments. The bank is small, but adequate. The pawnshop and store will see to your buying and selling needs, and the Tarath Wayside Inn is open at all hours to provide shelter for residents and foreigners alike.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: north east south* west.

l
The area brightens.
[Fort Tarath.]

Large barracks have been constructed here at the rear of the fort to house the on duty soldiers.  The buildings are made of wood and stone.  You shudder at the thought of how much effort it would take to get the lumber and other building supplies up the mountain.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).

l
The area brightens.
[Fort Tarath.]

You're standing at the rear entrance to the fort. As you look past the gate up the mountain you can see the long winding trail that makes its way up the cliff.  Just thinking about walking up there makes you feel tired.  An open wooden gate is here.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Gorge.]

The gorge ends here at the bottom of a massive gate.  The path here seems very well traveled, as you start to head north you can't help but notice the large boulders stacked to one side of the path so that you may pass.  An open wooden gate is here.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Gorge and The Silver Strand.]

The gorge continues onward as far as the eye can see while a newly excavated road opens up northwest. Black soot and ash, along with grey flecked dust has settled on everything in the area. A cool breeze rushes in from the new roadway, blowing with it the scent of moist air.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).

The area brightens.
[Tarath Gorge.]

The only sound you hear at this point is the soft click of rocks falling down the side of the steep walls. It seems like you could be buried alive under tons of rocks at any moment. Large boulders sit precariously above you, waiting for the slightest vibration to jar them loose.

l
The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

This newly constructed road begins the climb to the mountain peaks as a vein from the main Rathan-Fort Tarath artery. Following the steep incline of the mountain's side, this twisting path travels its way to the opposite side of the City of Rathan. High above in that part of the mountain, a single silver-spired tower peaks through the misty mountain air and glistens slightly.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).

l
The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

The roadway straightens out to the west but continues its incline along the base of the mountain. The walls of Fort Tarath stand tall between the walls of the gorge almost as if daring an army to try and breech them. Large piles of blackened rubble, the product of the roadway excavation, fill the narrow valley between the road edge and the mountain to the south.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

Small shrubs cling to the mountain side above the roadway, helping to sway the effects of erosion and the buffeting winds. A few small rocks, black and scorched, poke through the road close to the southern dropaway. Cold air blows down from the higher parts of the mountain, shaking leaves and dust into a frenzy every so often.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

High above the mountain base the roadway makes its climb toward the peak. Down below the cliff falls off suddenly into the valley. The sheer drop from the edge would crush even the largest animal on the boulders below. Wind blows up from the valley floor and down from the cliffs above, tugging at clothing, packs and living beings alike.
