The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

A huge boulder, imbedded within the side of the mountain, partially blocks the road. The boulders face is black and sooty, but no form of blasting seems to have made a dent. The roads direction was obviously changed to reflect this small problem.

[The Silver Strand.]

Small birds fly high overhead, circling this part of the road. The span from the edge of the road to the southern mountain face is not very far, however the drop into the valley would be suicide. On that mountain side a small cave yawns its opening next to a narrow ledge. Perhaps one could jump down to it without falling to their death...

[The Silver Strand.]

A small crack in the road spills forth a small stream of dirty brown water. Nearer the road edge, close to the drop down the mountain side, the erosion is terrible. In time, if the flow of water continues, the road may wash away without much of a trace.

[The Silver Strand.]

Misty clouds hang close to the mountain side, partially covering the road and making traveling dangerous. In some spots the mist is so thick, the edge of the road is hidden from view. Caution is needed when traveling this path.

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

The side of the mountain rises up to meet with the roadway higher on the mountain. Damp and cold air mixes with the warm breeze from down below making small clouds appear here and there. 

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: east* northwest.

[The Silver Strand.]

A stumble or trip would send anyone falling headlong, over the edge of the road and down, down onto the broken rocks far below. Wind whips around the corner from the southwest, blowing dust and debris into the air. Small loose rocks line the pathway making each step a dangerous course of action.

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

The strand twists and stretches and in some parts is not entirely there. Large holes open and close on its surface but without fail passage over these rifts is made without any problems. Above and surrounding the strand, the billowing clouds make up the walls of a silky tunnel, flickering with light and the sounds of rolling thunder every so often. The tunnel leads east to a solid mountain roadway and west into a blur.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.

l
The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

The strand and tunnel end abruptly before you, dispersing in the strong wind that blows down from the mountain. The next steps will have you hundreds of feet above the mountain base, standing on nothing but air, all solid footing gone. Across this long gap, on its otherside, the silver strand and the cloud tunnel begin again, making their way toward the mountain tower.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st troll and the 2nd troll.

l
The area brightens.
[Sky.]

There is nothing here but the open expanse of sky. A silvery walkway ends quite close to the east, its semi-solid footing welcome to most who cannot fly. Far northeast another part of the strand waits for a traveler to set foot on its surface to continue the journey up the mountain. A strong wind blows down from the mountain peak, attempting to bring the massive drop to the ground quickly and painfully to anyone stupid enough to wander out into the sky.  A fiery gate in the sky is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

What appears to be skeletal arm holding a gem encrusted sword is embedded deep within the crystal wall, almost like an insect encased in amber. [Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

A golden globe hovers in mid-air while sending sparks and flickering light across the face of the wall. Underneath the strange orb, a silver bowl sits on the floor, its body filled with small glowing embers. Smoke from the bowl rises up and curls around the globe while changing all of the colors of the rainbow.  An open crude bag, an open baggy calfhide bag, a closed smooth steelwood chest, a small bright agate charm, some silver coins, some chocolate covered fire ants, a rosewood carved ship in a bottle, and a fuzzy blue jester cap are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious exits: north* northeast* east*.

[Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

Like the first floor, the walls of the second rise up and angle slightly inward from floor to ceiling. Because of this, the area of the second floor is noticeably smaller then that of the first. However everything else is identical such as the deep purple crystal of the walls and the pulsing light from within.  A silver-trimmed spiraling crystal stairway is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st purple crystal golem, the 2nd purple crystal golem, and the 1st water golem.

A golden globe hovers in mid-air while sending sparks and flickering light across the face of the wall. Underneath the strange orb, a silver bowl sits on the floor, its body filled with small glowing embers. Smoke from the bowl rises up and curls around the globe while changing all of the colors of the rainbow.  Some chocolate covered fire ants, a rosewood carved ship in a bottle, and a fuzzy blue jester cap are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st purple crystal golem corpse, the 2nd purple crystal golem, and the 1st water golem.
In the room are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (holding a glowing enchanted turquoise snapdragon blossom), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious exits: north* northeast* east*.

What appears to be skeletal arm holding a gem encrusted sword is embedded deep within the crystal wall, almost like an insect encased in amber. Other then the fact that the arm belonged to a humanoid there is no distinction between any race known in the world. Whatever stories the previous owner could have told, this part of the body will never be able to reveal them.

[Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

A golden globe hovers in mid-air while sending sparks and flickering light across the face of the wall. Underneath the strange orb, a silver bowl sits on the floor, its body filled with small glowing embers. Some chocolate covered fire ants, a rosewood carved ship in a bottle, a fuzzy blue jester cap, and a small bright agate charm are here.

>[Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

A golden globe hovers in mid-air while sending sparks and flickering light across the face of the wall. [Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

A cool breeze blows down from the third floor landing, bringing with it the scents of magickal herbs. The walls glow brightly, the surface totally smooth and cool to the touch. A strange powdery substance, silver in color, covers the floor around the base of the stairway. [Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

What appears to be skeletal arm holding a gem encrusted sword is embedded deep within the crystal wall, almost like an insect encased in amber. Other then the fact that the arm belonged to a humanoid there is no distinction between any race known in the world. This room is illuminated.

[Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

A cool breeze blows down from the third floor landing, bringing with it the scents of magickal herbs. The walls glow brightly, the surface totally smooth and cool to the touch. A strange powdery substance, silver in color, covers the floor around the base of the stairway.  A silver-trimmed spiraling crystal stairway, a long bronze dagger, a straw hat, a cotton tunic, an obsidian figurine, a beautiful blue and green bluebird figurine, a two-handed oak quarterstaff, and a straw hat are here.

A cool breeze blows down from the third floor landing, bringing with it the scents of magickal herbs. The walls glow brightly, the surface totally smooth and cool to the touch. A strange powdery substance, silver in color, covers the floor around the base of the stairway.  A silver-trimmed spiraling crystal stairway, a long bronze dagger, a straw hat, a cotton tunic, an obsidian figurine, a beautiful blue and green bluebird figurine, a two-handed oak quarterstaff, a straw hat, and a closed faded steelwood coffer are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Gwen the Secian, Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious exits: south* southwest* west*.

Underneath the strange orb, a silver bowl sits on the floor, its body filled with small glowing embers. [Ilmand's Tower, Third Floor.]

Strange and wonderful smells assault the senses at the top of the spiral staircase. Odd clicking and the sound of birds singing can be hear all around, though there are no animals or anything else around to make them. [Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

A cool breeze blows down from the third floor landing, bringing with it the scents of magickal herbs. The walls glow brightly, the surface totally smooth and cool to the touch. A strange powdery substance, silver in color, covers the floor around the base of the stairway. [Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

A cool breeze blows down from the third floor landing, bringing with it the scents of magickal herbs. The walls glow brightly, the surface totally smooth and cool to the touch. A strange powdery substance, silver in color, covers the floor around the base of the stairway.  A silver-trimmed spiraling crystal stairway, a long bronze dagger, a straw hat, a cotton tunic, a beautiful blue and green bluebird figurine, a two-handed oak quarterstaff, a straw hat, a light cloth jerkin, and a short steel butcher knife are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st water golem.

[Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

A cool breeze blows down from the third floor landing, bringing with it the scents of magickal herbs. The walls glow brightly, the surface totally smooth and cool to the touch. A strange powdery substance, silver in color, covers the floor around the base of the stairway.  A silver-trimmed spiraling crystal stairway, a long bronze dagger, a straw hat, a cotton tunic, a beautiful blue and green bluebird figurine, a two-handed oak quarterstaff, a straw hat, a light cloth jerkin, a short steel butcher knife, and a closed dirty gold box are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st water golem and the 1st purple crystal golem.
In the room are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Gwen the Secian, Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.

[Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

A golden globe hovers in mid-air while sending sparks and flickering light across the face of the wall. Underneath the strange orb, a silver bowl sits on the floor, its body filled with small glowing embers. Smoke from the bowl rises up and curls around the globe while changing all of the colors of the rainbow.  Some chocolate covered fire ants, a rosewood carved ship in a bottle, a twisted blood red strand of beads, a tiny pink and blue tulip, a silver mirror, a bent tin earring, a tattered flowing pennant on a pole, a brightly painted paper fan, a small heart-shaped black jade figurine, a light cloth jerkin, an iron chainmail coif, a red and white checked flannel shirt, a cotton tunic, and a small glimmering red coral bead are here.

[Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

A golden globe hovers in mid-air while sending sparks and flickering light across the face of the wall. Underneath the strange orb, a silver bowl sits on the floor, its body filled with small glowing embers. Smoke from the bowl rises up and curls around the globe while changing all of the colors of the rainbow.  A cotton tunic, a small glimmering red coral bead, a blue and white striped cup, some weathered black bearskin furs, some blood-stained leather gloves, a two-handed oak quarterstaff, some blood-stained grey leather breeches, some weathered black bearskin furs, a steelwood shield, a closed reed basket, a frightening obsidian vulture figurine, a majestic carved oak owl charm, a light cloth jerkin, a closed brilliant multicolored parasol, a lyre, a wooden shield, and a pair of bearskin pants are here.

[Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

What appears to be skeletal arm holding a gem encrusted sword is embedded deep within the crystal wall, almost like an insect encased in amber. Other then the fact that the arm belonged to a humanoid there is no distinction between any race known in the world. [Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

A cool breeze blows down from the third floor landing, bringing with it the scents of magickal herbs. The walls glow brightly, the surface totally smooth and cool to the touch. A strange powdery substance, silver in color, covers the floor around the base of the stairway.  A silver-trimmed spiraling crystal stairway, a long bronze dagger, a straw hat, a cotton tunic, a beautiful blue and green bluebird figurine, a two-handed oak quarterstaff, a straw hat, a light cloth jerkin, a short steel butcher knife, a dark braided leather slaver's whip, some weathered black bearskin furs, a pair of muddy leather boots, and a star patterned cloth headband are here.

[Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

[The Silver Strand.]

The strand has totally solidified, its silver-black surface smooth and shiny. A low humming sound permeates the air along with short thunderous bursts and flickers of lightning. The tower is almost completely in view, its shining purple walls glowing brightly. At the tip of the spire, glowing bright purple, stands a beautifully crafted scarab, its outstretched wings glistening silver.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian, Gwen the Secian, Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east northwest*.

Forsythia glances down at her claws and squints at Draffut.

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

The purple and silver glow brightens as the tunnel walls begin to fully dissipate in the mountain breeze. To the north the partially hidden spire of a massive tower pokes through the glistening cloud cover. A purple glow reflects through the cover and across the face of the building, beautifully accented by the silver trim and polished silver spire.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian, Gwen the Secian, Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.

[The Silver Strand.]

The narrow silver strand bends and stretches as it begins again. Billowing clouds part long enough for one to glimpse the entire southern half of Tarath Bends in all of its majesty. The area brightens.
[Sky.]

Nothing but sky and mountains stretch out on all sides. The drop from this height would surely be deadly to anyone. A sliver of silver glints in the distance, rolling slightly within a wall of clouds. To the northeast, as if floating in the sky, a large tower hovers under it's own power. A small white curl of smoke reaches out from the tower towards the small silver path.  Some alabaster upwards leading stairs are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st night mosquito, the 2nd night mosquito, and the 3rd night mosquito.

The area brightens.
[Sky.]

There is nothing here but the open expanse of sky. A silvery walkway ends quite close to the east, its semi-solid footing welcome to most who cannot fly. Far northeast another part of the strand waits for a traveler to set foot on its surface to continue the journey up the mountain. A strong wind blows down from the mountain peak, attempting to bring the massive drop to the ground quickly and painfully to anyone stupid enough to wander out into the sky.  A fiery gate in the sky is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st night mosquito.

[The Silver Strand.]

The strand twists and stretches and in some parts is not entirely there. Large holes open and close on its surface but without fail passage over these rifts is made without any problems. Above and surrounding the strand, the billowing clouds make up the walls of a silky tunnel, flickering with light and the sounds of rolling thunder every so often. The tunnel leads east to a solid mountain roadway and west into a blur.

[The Silver Strand.]

A ribbon of pure silver stretches out through the billowing clouds toward the peak of the mountain. Each step is like walking on soft carpeting but without any solid underfooting to hold one up. The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

Another massive boulder, black and melted, blocks any further passage toward the top of the mountain. Thick grey and white clouds hang heavily near the edge of the road, swirling ever so slightly in the breeze. There is no way to continue up the mountain except perhaps by climbing the sheer cliff wall. The clouds pulse slightly and gravitate toward the road surface, the sound of thunder rolling over the area. 

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian, Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: southeast.

[The Silver Strand.]

High above the mountain base the roadway makes its climb toward the peak. Down below the cliff falls off suddenly into the valley. The sheer drop from the edge would crush even the largest animal on the boulders below. Wind blows up from the valley floor and down from the cliffs above, tugging at clothing, packs and living beings alike.

[Fort Tarath.]

Each corner of this square gives entrance to one of the fort's four business establishments. The bank is small, but adequate. The pawnshop and store will see to your buying and selling needs, and the Tarath Wayside Inn is open at all hours to provide shelter for residents and foreigners alike.

You find something suitably reflective and gaze into it...

You look like a 1'2" standard adolescent delicate boned, wirey-tough bodied Secian Cleric.
You have very long, wild, kinky white hair with a white streak, heavy lidded pale red eyes, and look disheveled.
You appear to be aristocratic right now.
You can be attacked by other players.

[Fort Tarath.]

Each corner of this square gives entrance to one of the fort's four business establishments. The bank is small, but adequate. The pawnshop and store will see to your buying and selling needs, and the Tarath Wayside Inn is open at all hours to provide shelter for residents and foreigners alike.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian, Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.

>[Fort Tarath, Bank.]

This is a secondary branch of the Bank of Rathan.  Here, your money can be deposited safely.  A handful of tellers man the windows in order to help you around the clock.  An exit is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian, Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious exits: None.

The area brightens.
[Fort Tarath.]

Each corner of this square gives entrance to one of the fort's four business establishments. The bank is small, but adequate. The pawnshop and store will see to your buying and selling needs, and the Tarath Wayside Inn is open at all hours to provide shelter for residents and foreigners alike.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian, Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

This newly constructed road begins the climb to the mountain peaks as a vein from the main Rathan-Fort Tarath artery. Following the steep incline of the mountain's side, this twisting path travels its way to the opposite side of the City of Rathan. High above in that part of the mountain, a single silver-spired tower peaks through the misty mountain air and glistens slightly.

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

Another massive boulder, black and melted, blocks any further passage toward the top of the mountain. Thick grey and white clouds hang heavily near the edge of the road, swirling ever so slightly in the breeze. There is no way to continue up the mountain except perhaps by climbing the sheer cliff wall. The clouds pulse slightly and gravitate toward the road surface, the sound of thunder rolling over the area. 

This area is illuminated.

Obvious paths: southeast*.
[The Silver Strand.]

Another massive boulder, black and melted, blocks any further passage toward the top of the mountain. Thick grey and white clouds hang heavily near the edge of the road, swirling ever so slightly in the breeze. There is no way to continue up the mountain except perhaps by climbing the sheer cliff wall. The clouds pulse slightly and gravitate toward the road surface, the sound of thunder rolling over the area. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st night mosquito.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian, Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: southeast.
>
You follow Forsythia through some white billowy clouds...


A night mosquito enters, following Forsythia's group.

l
The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

A ribbon of pure silver stretches out through the billowing clouds toward the peak of the mountain. Each step is like walking on soft carpeting but without any solid underfooting to hold one up. Any movement on the silver strand makes the surface flow like the waves on the ocean, rippling into the distance.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st night mosquito.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian, Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

The strand twists and stretches and in some parts is not entirely there. Large holes open and close on its surface but without fail passage over these rifts is made without any problems. Above and surrounding the strand, the billowing clouds make up the walls of a silky tunnel, flickering with light and the sounds of rolling thunder every so often. The tunnel leads east to a solid mountain roadway and west into a blur.

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

The strand and tunnel end abruptly before you, dispersing in the strong wind that blows down from the mountain. The next steps will have you hundreds of feet above the mountain base, standing on nothing but air, all solid footing gone. Across this long gap, on its otherside, the silver strand and the cloud tunnel begin again, making their way toward the mountain tower.

[Sky.]

There is nothing here but the open expanse of sky. A silvery walkway ends quite close to the east, its semi-solid footing welcome to most who cannot fly. Far northeast another part of the strand waits for a traveler to set foot on its surface to continue the journey up the mountain. A strong wind blows down from the mountain peak, attempting to bring the massive drop to the ground quickly and painfully to anyone stupid enough to wander out into the sky.  A fiery gate in the sky is here.

[Phoenix Gate.]

You stand upon a small island floating amoungst the clouds. Glowing purple crystal formations stand to each of the cardinal directions of the island's perimeter. The area brightens.
[Temple of Rinanni, Courtyard.]

A cobblestone path winds its way through a beautiful garden of multicolored flowers, arched trellises, and weeping willow trees. The path ends at the entrance to the glimmering Temple of Rinanni. The glorious structure, constructed out of pure white marble and lustrous purple crystal, rises many stories and radiates a luminous violet glow. White and violet robed priests casually stroll up and down the small pathway.  An open ivy-covered wrought iron gate, a pair of open luminescent purple crystal doors, a small path under the willows, and a rose entwined wooden arbor are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian, Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.

[Rear Palace Gateway.]

Opposite the marble stairway and across the cobblestone pathway, another gate, this one of black wrought-iron, stands within the center of the fence which runs behind the garden. [Rear Garden Path.]

An aging silver willow droops its silky limbs to the ground. Thick greenish-yellow moss covers the ground beneath the shadowy trunk, while tiny annual flowers poke through the mulch covered garden floor. The scents of honeysuckle and roses float through the damp air whenever a low breeze plays through the area. Far overhead, on the opposite side of the Silver Mountain peak, a large silver-spired tower can be seen.

[Entryway.]

Deep turquoise crystal pillars support a domed roof of frosted glass. In the very center of the massive dome is an etching of a silver-eyed turquoise Dragon in mid-flight with a turquoise winged Secian upon her shoulder. A mosaic of tiles depicting a flight of dragons in all their colors spreads out in front of small waterfall that steadily flows into a crystal clear pool. Velvet pillows in a myriad of colors are scattered around allowing for a spot to rest and converse. Tiny candles with enchanted blue flames line the walls on turquoise sconces, filling the room with an eternal warm light.  A breathtaking flowing waterfall, a blue and white swirled crystal candy dish, a smooth turquoise platter, some brightly colored pillows, a large tasseled turquoise velvet pillow, a small silver-trimmed turquoise silk pillow, an intricately inlaid tile mosaic, and an open giant turquoise trimmed steel drawbridge are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious exits: None.

[Forsythia's Chamber]

The air is brisk with an icy chill reminding of the coldest winter days, hitting you with full force upon entering this underground room. The chamber is completely dark except for a few areas where the walls and ceiling glitter with shining turquoise gems. Deep cracks have been carved sporadically, seemingly by the force of claws. Jagged stalactites hang from the ceiling almost touching the floor in some areas, deadly sharp and freezing to the touch. In the center of the area is an enormous pool, the waters crystal clear and pure. Along the very bottom of the seemingly depthless pool smooth turquoise gems have been placed with care for safekeeping, a large star shaped figurine of a breathtaking blue green in the middle in remembrance of many nights of stargazing. A few piles of gems line the corners, carefully stacked next to large chests of treasure. Massive boulders line the water, one stands out in particular perfectly smooth.  A breathtaking pile of turquoise gems, an enormous smooth flat rock, a closed turquoise encrusted driftwood sea chest, a closed turquoise banded opal treasure box, and a closed antique stone turquoise handled armor cabinet are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet below you), and Forsythia the Drake (flying 10 feet below you).
Obvious exits: None.

You are now at 15 feet.

[Forsythia's Chamber]

The air is brisk with an icy chill reminding of the coldest winter days, hitting you with full force upon entering this underground room. The chamber is completely dark except for a few areas where the walls and ceiling glitter with shining turquoise gems. Deep cracks have been carved sporadically, seemingly by the force of claws. Jagged stalactites hang from the ceiling almost touching the floor in some areas, deadly sharp and freezing to the touch. In the center of the area is an enormous pool, the waters crystal clear and pure. Along the very bottom of the seemingly depthless pool smooth turquoise gems have been placed with care for safekeeping, a large star shaped figurine of a breathtaking blue green in the middle in remembrance of many nights of stargazing. A few piles of gems line the corners, carefully stacked next to large chests of treasure. Massive boulders line the water, one stands out in particular perfectly smooth.  A breathtaking pile of turquoise gems, an enormous smooth flat rock, a closed turquoise encrusted driftwood sea chest, an open turquoise banded opal treasure box, and a closed antique stone turquoise handled armor cabinet are here.

[Hot Springs.]

Steam radiates off of the springs surface, making the air inside the room warm and humid. Lush tropical vegetation grows around the edges of the pool, some brilliantly colored lilies sprouting from the water itself. Flowered creeping vines grow up the walls and weave together across the ceiling, perfuming the area with a light, sweet scent. Here and there bits of bluish glowing moss dot the walls, lighting the area softly.  A warm blue green spring, some pure white lilies, some flowered creepers, a giant turquoise streaked ivory clam shell, a weathered sunken treasure chest, and a breathtaking flowing waterfall are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draffut the Drake (flying beside you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Gwen the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious exits: None.

Gwen giggles at Forsythia.

Forsythia says, "Our hot springs."

You whistle.

[Deep Forest Bedroom.]

A huge luminescent crystalline tree grows from the center of the room, a tangle of branches spread out over you into the ceiling. A menagerie of exotic animals are woven into the long rug stretching from one end of the room to the other. Fine fabric wall hangings cover the walls depicting slightly different scenes in turn; from a deep forest, to the seas edge. Dark stained wooden chairs and table have been carved expertly with sylvan imagery and sit on the far side of the room. In front of a large bay window stands a huge sleigh bed covered with a mossy green bedspread whose coloring is carried through into the draperies.  An ivy carved mahogany sleigh bed, a closed vine carved mahogany trunk, a turquoise inlaid ivory serving tray, a smooth ivory candy dish, and a tiny glass fish bowl are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st thick maned black stallion (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Genelyn the Secian (flying 10 feet below you), Gwen the Secian, and Forsythia the Drake (flying 10 feet below you).

[Entryway.]

Deep turquoise crystal pillars support a domed roof of frosted glass. In the very center of the massive dome is an etching of a silver-eyed turquoise Dragon in mid-flight with a turquoise winged Secian upon her shoulder. A mosaic of tiles depicting a flight of dragons in all their colors spreads out in front of small waterfall that steadily flows into a crystal clear pool. Velvet pillows in a myriad of colors are scattered around allowing for a spot to rest and converse. Tiny candles with enchanted blue flames line the walls on turquoise sconces, filling the room with an eternal warm light.  A breathtaking flowing waterfall, a blue and white swirled crystal candy dish, a smooth turquoise platter, some brightly colored pillows, a large tasseled turquoise velvet pillow, a small silver-trimmed turquoise silk pillow, an intricately inlaid tile mosaic, and a closed giant turquoise trimmed steel drawbridge are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Western Garden Lane.]

Flowering shrubs and thin aspen trees spread out through the western garden, stopping only at the grey base of the mountain which soars high overhead. A small pond, filled with white swans and tall grassy plants, extends from the cobblestone path and further into the garden. The moist air is cool and tends to cling to the broad leafed trees that reach their limbs above the pathway.  A closed giant turquoise trimmed steel drawbridge and a deep bluish green moat are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Rathan, Palace Road.]

A tall, gateless wrought-iron fence contains the palace gardens from the main road. The fence begins at this corner and travels to the west, where it has been attached to the solid rock face of the mountain side. The area brightens.
[Rathan, The Great Gate.]

A pleasant breeze rustles the hardy pine trees which line this cobblestone street. A large establishment of deep purple crystal dwarfs the other structures, its silver spires reaching high overhead. Just beyond the elegant structure, the Silver Mountain provides a sense of safety. The street widens sharply to the east and west in a delta of smoother stone, either side trailed by a lawn of low-cut green grass. A polished white stairway leads up to a great silver gate, its body set within a massive carved archway which itself is centered within the crystal wall.  An announcement and an ornate silver gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east southeast south* southwest west*.
[Rathan, The Great Gate.]

A pleasant breeze rustles the hardy pine trees which line this cobblestone street. A large establishment of deep purple crystal dwarfs the other structures, its silver spires reaching high overhead. You follow Forsythia south...

[Rathanus Road.]

A short distance ahead, giant silver gates bar passage to Rathan Palace. The pedicured lawn and expertly pruned topiaries blend well against the dark granite Palace walls. The plaza to the south bustles with activity as the citizens of Rathan barter loudly with some foreign merchants from a large trade caravan.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Forsythia south...

[Rathanus Road.]

Rathanus Road is the main street of Rathan. Running directly from the city gates at the south end of the city and north through the central plaza where the roadway ends directly at the steps of a beautiful purple crystal palace. As one of the beautiful symbols of Rathan City, Rathanus road is kept in pristine condition, throughout every season.  An open gilded silver gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Forsythia through an open gilded silver gate...

[Central Plaza North.]

A silvery paved road joins the plaza through a gilded silver gate and continues north toward the Rathene Royal Palace. Sculpted flowering topiaries and marble benches adorn the area. The haunting melody of a violin can be heard from an open window set in the large building to the side of the street. Every so often pairs of hand holding young lovers and elegantly dressed nobles with their package laden attendants will wander by.  An open gilded silver gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.

You follow Forsythia south...

[Central Plaza Square.]

A beautiful crystal fountain, topped with the statue of King Rathanus the First, resides at the center of the plaza square. Water sprays from the king's open mouth and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular marble tiled pool. The fountain, a tribute to the founding ruler of Rathan, symbolizes Rathanus granting the breath of life to the once barren mountain side. Luminous crystal street lanterns, gilded marble benches, and delicately pruned rose bushes surround the perimeter of the square. Located at the very heart of the city, the plaza serves as a focal point for both business and casual interactions.  A large glistening silver crystal fountain, some silver gilded marble benches, and some blooming silvery bushes of Rathene roses are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st confused-looking oog-ra and the 2nd confused-looking oog-ra.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Forsythia south...

[Central Plaza South.]

A group of traveling buskers have set up a small stage at the southern end of the plaza. The odd looking trio is made up of a tiny Human child playing a tambourine, a beautiful Fir Elf maiden playing a lute, and a Human man, with the largest nose you have ever seen, playing the fiddle. Breathtaking music, the likes of which you have never heard, fills the air as the trio dances around the stage. Groups of townsfolk applaud and toss silver coins into the large bucket at the base of the stage.  An open gilded silver gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st frontacian runemage and the 2nd frontacian runemage.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* west* northwest*.

You follow Forsythia through an open gilded silver gate...

[Rathanus Road.]

Royal guards stand watch over the entrance to a large plaza surrounded by pristine marble and woodworked buildings. A gilded silver gate set into a giant marble archway leads into the heart of the city of Rathan. Horse drawn wagons and patrols of city guards come and go from the impressive entryway.  Some large wooden and marble buildings and an open gilded silver gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.
Obvious paths: south.

You follow Forsythia south...

The area brightens.
[Rathanus Road.]

The snowcapped peak of the Silver Mountain towers above the city to the north. Tall wood and stone buildings can be seen behind the ivy covered wrought iron fences along both sides of the road. Applauding and merry music can be heard from somewhere nearby.  Some large wooden and stone houses, some tall evergreen trees, and an ivy-covered wrought iron fence are here.

[Rathanus Road.]

Stately homes, with manicured lawns and ivy covered fences, rise along both sides of the road. The traffic upon the road is mostly made up of glittering silver horse drawn carriages, patrols of royal guards, and the occasional rickety farmer's wagon. The carriages pull into the entrances of expensive looking homes and depart as quickly as they came, carrying wealthy noblemen off to various locales around the city.  Some large wooden and stone houses, an ivy-covered wrought iron fence, and some wild Rathene roses are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Rathanus Road & Treewort Avenue.]

A luxurious pine log building stands at the corner of Rathanus Road and Treewort Avenue. Colorful stained glass windows and ivy-covered balconies grace the exterior of the elegant structure. An ornate silver sign hangs above the entrance engraved with the image of a mug imposed over the outline of a mountain. Upon the sign are words etched in a flowing script which read, "The Silver Mountain Inn". Pleasant music and laughter originate from within.  A pair of closed artfully carved oak doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.

The area brightens.
[Rathanus Road.]

The grand ivy covered buildings of the city of Rathan rise side by side along the road and increase in splendor further to the north. Large stained glass windows, silvery rooftops, and artfully crafted wood workings adorn the majestic structures. Townsfolk casually stroll down the silver paved streets, enjoying the crisp mountain air. The savory aroma of food roasting over a log fire drifts in from somewhere nearby.  Some wooden and stone buildings, an ivy-covered wrought iron fence, and some wild violet lilacs are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake, Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake.

[Rathanus Road.]

A small, chilly-looking stream rushes briskly down the rocky terrain, and an ancient stone bridge provides passage across it. The bridge itself has been slightly eroded by time, but its demonic features are still quite visible. The pleasant moonflowers that bloom at its base provide a stark contrast to the bridge's sinister appeal.  An ancient demon-headed stone bridge, a flowing pale blue stream, and some glowing silvery moonflowers are here.

[City of Rathan, Main Gate.]

A wide silver paved road begins at the city's main gate and ascends toward the heart of Rathan. The scenic view of the city from this point is truly captivating. A multitude of silvery roofed buildings, surrounded by tall evergreen trees, rise along the Silver Mountain's southern slope. Far to the north, the snowcapped peak of the Silver Mountain rises above the glimmering crystal dome of the Rathene Royal Palace. City guards, merchants, and townsfolk continuously pass through the gate set in the outer wall to the south.  A giant carved granite wall, an open giant silver gate, and some glowing silvery moonflowers are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Entry Passage.]

The open passageway serves as a buffer between the inner and outer gates of the city of Rathan. Giant stone towers, connected by wooden walkways overhead, stand to each side of the passage. Silvery clad archers patrol the ramparts above. In times of emergency the city's gates can be closed simultaneously to entrap invaders.  An open silver spiked drathain portcullis and an open giant silver gate are here.

This area is illuminated.

Loose rocks litter the trail beneath your feet.  Large grooves scar the face of the wall as they ascend to the ridge above you.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast* west.
[Demon Slope.]

Loose rocks litter the trail beneath your feet.  Large grooves scar the face of the wall as they ascend to the ridge above you.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast west.
>
You follow Forsythia west...


l
The area brightens.
[Demon Slope.]

The thin air high atop the mountain makes it difficult to continue.  Your lungs burn from oxygen deprivation and the effects of hypoxia are beginning to show.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* west.

l
The area brightens.
[Demon Slope.]

As you stand and listen you hear the sounds of hooves clattering on rock and the occasional crack of horns colliding.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

l
The area brightens.
[Demon Slope.]

Looking up you notice the face of the cliff narrowing substantially indicating that the summit of the mountain must be close.  Down below the trail winds its way into the mist.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

l
The area brightens.
[Demon Slope.]

The trail twists sharply as it heads off toward the other side of the cliff face.  The frigid air blowing past causes your ears to sting.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

l
The area brightens.
[Demon Slope.]

The trail twists back on itself and continues up the mountain.  The strong winds whip past you and race out away from the cliff.  A giant sign is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

l
The area brightens.
[Demon Slope.]

Grooves cut deep into the rock cause the wind to whistle as it rushes by.  Using the cuts in the rock as a grip you continue on.

l
The area brightens.
[Demon Slope.]

A short woman wrapped in a black cloak sits against the wall of rock, her body apparently overcome by the cold.  The ice built up on her body indicates that she's been here quite a while.

This area is illuminated.

[Demon Slope.]

Staying low to the path helps you avoid getting blown off the ridge. The wind gusts are strong and relentless in their efforts to push you back.

[Demon Slope.]

As the trail bends and turns back across the face of the mountain you can feel a definite increase in the wind velocity.  Your wet clothing has begun to freeze.

l
The area brightens.
[Demon Slope.]

The bleating of a mountain goat can be heard from somewhere nearby. Some wayward traveller has inscribed something in the rock, but it has become illegible over time.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* west.

[Demon Slope.]

The trail continues up the mountain and out of the gorge.  A slight breeze blows across your face as you look upwards towards the top of the mountain.  To the west the trail continues up the slope.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast west*.
[Demon Slope.]

The trail continues up the mountain and out of the gorge.  A slight breeze blows across your face as you look upwards towards the top of the mountain.  To the west the trail continues up the slope.

l
The area brightens.
[Demon Slope.]

The transition from the gorge to the slope is a sharp and nearly instantaneous one.  Looking up the mountain you can see the trail curve away from you.  A crumbling path is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

The area brightens.
[Tarath Gorge.]

The gorge ends here in a slope that runs to the northwest. A silvery glint from the rocks towering above you catches your eye, and a close look reveals that small amounts of silver are still embedded in some of the rock formations.  A giant sign is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

The area brightens.
[Tarath Gorge.]

The only sound you hear at this point is the soft click of rocks falling down the side of the steep walls. It seems like you could be buried alive under tons of rocks at any moment. Large boulders sit precariously above you, waiting for the slightest vibration to jar them loose.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Gorge and The Silver Strand.]

The gorge continues onward as far as the eye can see while a newly excavated road opens up northwest. Black soot and ash, along with grey flecked dust has settled on everything in the area. A cool breeze rushes in from the new roadway, blowing with it the scent of moist air.

This area is illuminated.

[Fort Tarath.]

Each corner of this square gives entrance to one of the fort's four business establishments. The bank is small, but adequate. The pawnshop and store will see to your buying and selling needs, and the Tarath Wayside Inn is open at all hours to provide shelter for residents and foreigners alike.

[Tarath Bends.]

A massive rent opens up between the mountain side heading south. Boulders sit precariously on the mountain side ready to fall to the ground. l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Old trees lay side by side with the massive boulders of the mountain, intermingling in a terrible landslide. The mountain top has broken off and slid across the eastern road stopping all forms of transportation. It would take years for mortal hands to remove the tons of stone from the original roadway to make it passable once again. Thankfully, nature has changed the landscape for the better, and has opened a gap through the mountain to the north.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* southwest.
[Tarath Bends.]

Old trees lay side by side with the massive boulders of the mountain, intermingling in a terrible landslide. The mountain top has broken off and slid across the eastern road stopping all forms of transportation. It would take years for mortal hands to remove the tons of stone from the original roadway to make it passable once again. Thankfully, nature has changed the landscape for the better, and has opened a gap through the mountain to the north.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north southwest.
>
You follow Forsythia southwest...

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east southwest*.
[Tarath Bends.]

The earth trembles as the newly formed landslide continues to settle. Small rocks and other debris tumble from the top and sides of the formation. The landslide rises, insurmountable to the east and southwest, however from this point one could traverse the peak to the other side.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east southwest.
>
You follow Forsythia east...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Here is a quiet little grove at the base of the hill to the north, which casts its shadow over the aspens and evergreens.  The area is tranquil and calm.  You can forge through the undergrowth to the west or head towards the hill back north.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast southeast.
>You look up...
In the area are Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
>
You follow Forsythia southeast...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The path continues to twist and turn, seeming to dodge mounds of jagged rock and the occasional fresh-water stream.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st ogre.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Besides the rock wall that divides you from traveling anywhere but where the road leads you, the mountains give a very refreshing feeling as you travel them.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The road here forks in three directions. The area to the southeast seems to be more forested than where you are now. A small mountain of rock splits the two other paths to the west and northwest.

The area brightens.

The road becomes much more rugged and rocky to the north, while a large expanse of forests covers the landscape to the south. The twists and turns in the road make it impossible to see far ahead. You grow apprehensive as you realize that the terrain is perfect for ambushes.

[North Bridge Trail.]

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A large house made of wood, logs, bark and other forest materials stands prominently in the middle of this small clearing. A small graveyard with many gravemarkers lies next to the house. Much of the ground in the graveyard has been upturned, and you feel you'd rather not know why.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A variety of strange markings cover the ground, most of them are unlike anything you have ever seen before. An experienced and well traveled forester might have some hope of identifying the creatures that made them, but the task is beyond your capabilities. Smoke billows out of the woods to the north, and you wonder what lies there.

This area is illuminated.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Even though it is bright here you think you see little shadowy shapes scurrying about.  You quickly turn your head and they are gone.  Out of the corner of your eye you see them again, but as you turn towards them, they vanish.  You notice something strange lurking here.  

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

You find yourself standing on the brink of a large cliff. A large landslide has cleared the trees from the area, exposing the soil to erosion. You trip over some of the loose rubble and are almost sent plunging down into oblivion before you manage to catch yourself.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A beggar lies here asking you to kindly spare him some food. By the looks of him, he hasn't shaved in months, and the smell of Dragon Ale hangs heavy in the air around him. Some stop and share a few silver with him, but most just wander past ignoring his loud request.

[North Bridge Trail.]

This part of the road is covered with rocks and pebbles, making it a rough stretch for the barefooted to cross. Bushes and small trees push their way onto the road from the roadsides.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

From all appearances, it looks like the road builders should have gone straight north, yet they didn't. It's almost as if they were blocked by something. The clump of trees to the north seems very thick, but that shouldn't have stopped determined builders. As you puzzle over the matter, you think you hear something calling you. You shake your head and move on.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

[North Bridge Trail.]

From all appearances, it looks like the road builders should have gone straight north, yet they didn't. It's almost as if they were blocked by something. The clump of trees to the north seems very thick, but that shouldn't have stopped determined builders. As you puzzle over the matter, you think you hear something calling you. You shake your head and move on.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast southeast.
>
Bant ponders the meaning of the universe for a moment.

You follow Forsythia southeast...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

You find yourself climbing one of the few steep hills in this forest. The road rises at a sharp angle, but the passage is still fairly easy. You hear soft growling in the distance, and decide to move onward.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east northwest*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The forest on either side of the road seems to be closing in on you.  The road curves to the west and southeast here.  Squirrels and chipmunks scurry across the rocky path.  The green of the mountains is concealed by the treetops.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The air is thick with the foul odor of a nearby swamp. The ground, though firm, is damp and muddy. A thick fog clings to the ground to the east marking the spot where the swamp begins.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east west*.
[North Bridge Trail.]

>
You follow Forsythia east...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The ground is moist and yielding. A thick layer of sludge covers everything in sight accompanied by a thin ground fog that recedes as it rolls toward the west, away from the swamp.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east west*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A thick mist covers the ground, making it difficult to discern where solid footing lies. A large rock protrudes from the swampy water. Though shaped naturally, it could easily be mistaken for a dragon curled up in a comfortable sleep.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast west*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A thin strip of solid ground cuts a precarious path through the center of the bog. Small bubbles of mud form just off the path, releasing noxious gasses as they burst. The mist thick cloud formed by the gas drops visibility to almost nothing.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east northwest*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Dead misshapen trees rise from the surface of the putrid water. Their ghostly forms claw up through the thick fog of foul-smelling marsh gas.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Small patches of solid ground lie hidden by murky, leech-infested water. The ground beneath the surface of the bog is uneven and has a tendency to drop off sharply without warning.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

You follow Forsythia east...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Overflow from the nearby Silver River has turned much of the surrounding land into a muddy bog. Knee-deep and ice cold, the thick muddy water obscures the path from view. 

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast west*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The outline of a tall stone bridge can be made out to the southwest. The sound of flowing water roars loudly from that direction as well. Grassland is all that the eye can see in the immediate area to the northwest. Though the Great Divide is visible in the distance, its massive snow-covered peaks extending to the heavens, making everything else seem small in comparison. 

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast northwest*.

l
The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

The massive stone bridge spans the mighty Silver River. The torrent of the river below rushes past the remains of the old bridge, carrying away bits of debris. Once heaping piles of building materials, now greatly dwindled lie discarded beside the bridge.  A broken wooden wagon is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: south northwest*.

>
You follow Forsythia south...


l
The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

An osprey soars above the raging Silver River, scanning the water for a meal. Suddenly, it dives down to the surface and snatches a rather large trout from the water. The trout wriggles helplessly in the large birds grip as it is carried off on the western horizon.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* south.

l
The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

Extremely sturdy, though quickly rebuilt, the magnificent bridge spans across the mighty Silver River. Banners flutter in the breeze on both sides of the bridge, marking its reopening. Small gaps in the mortar are visible where the workers quickly pieced the stones together.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* south.

l
The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

The river surges strongly below you. Even from this height the noise of the flowing water is near deafening. Two small fishing boats nearly collide as they try to pass between the same set of supports. Only skillful sailing prevents them from hitting each other, or the supports. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rogue.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

The bridge was built tall to allow the various merchant ships to pass under it. Its  height allows for a splendid view of the countryside, from Spur to the southeast, to the majestic peaks of the Great Divide.

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The path is muddy and in some places the murky water is knee-deep. The Silver River is constantly overflowing as the muddy path clearly points out. The shape of a bridge crossing the river can be made out just in the distance to the northwest.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The western bank of the Silver River is composed of ankle-deep mud and slime the river washed upon the shore. A fish, that was unlucky enough to be swept ashore, flops itself about desperately trying to get back to the sanctuary of the water.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st ork.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The Silver River cuts through the grassland and heads southeast towards Spur. Fishing boats, bearing the crest of the of city of Spur, dart around several barges laden with exotic wares to trade in the merchant city. Most bear the livery of the city of Rathan, but every so often a ship flying unfamiliar colors can be sighted.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

A crumbling arch lies off the path to the east. It stands as the last reminder of an inn that once offered solace to the weary that traveled this path. It can be discerned from the blackened color of the arch that the inn was the unfortunate victim of a fire.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

Patches of dandelions grow randomly about the roadside. Occasionally a breeze picks up and scatters their fluffy white pollen about the countryside, furthering the dandelions goal to cover every square inch of the grasslands.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

A small clearing in the grass has been formed inside a cluster of large blackened rocks. The centerpiece to this well used rest area is a fire pit filled with charred wood and ash. Though the fire has burned out it still gives off a small amount of heat, suggesting it was used recently.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rabid dog and the 2nd rabid dog.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

To the southeast the road disappears into a dense patch of thorny brambles. A burned out cart lies battered in a ditch at the side of the road. The cart bears the markings of the city of Rathan as well as those of the Rathene merchants guild.

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

Thorny vines reach out across the path making travel difficult. The thicket has become so overgrown that it is nearly impassable in places. The ground is worn by the soles of countless feet, making the dense wall of bramble seem even more out of place.

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

Thick thorny brambles line the path, as a further reminder to travelers that straying from their heading may be unwise. The road looks poorly tended in places, most notably where the brambles have spread beyond its outer boundaries.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

Thick brambles grow high and deep along both sides of the road. Sharp dagger-like thorns ready to welcome anyone unlucky enough to wander off the path. Small ragged pieces of cloth decorate the sharp thorns where some foolish travelers thought they could take a short cut.

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The air is still and quiet except for the sound of a single cricket chirping away furiously to the left of the path. To the northwest the grasslands give way to a thorny bramble thicket that, in places, engulfs the road.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

A muddy pool of water lies to the north, nothing can be seen below its murky surface. The smell of rotting flesh rises from the pool and is carried for a great distance by the wind. The skeletal remains of what was once a cow lies half submerged in the water, its carcass picked clean by scavengers. 

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

Farm animals graze in the distance. Their vague forms barely visible as they lumber about the tall grass. To the north the flat grassland gives way to the rolling foothills of the Great Divide. The mountains themselves are nothing more than ghostly images fading in and out of view on the horizon.   

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st foreign merchant.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

To the southwest the ghostly outline of a forest can be seen darkening the area around it like a blight upon the land. Grassy plains stretch out to the west. Swarms of tiny insects hover just above the grass, in some places the swarms are so dense they take on the appearance of being a single entity.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* south.

[West Spur Road.]

The path is flanked by countless tall oaks, swaying peacefully in the wind. They do their best to hide the sky from view, making it hard to tell night from day at times. Littering the area are pieces of broken wagon, bits of human remains and dried splotches of blood. The remnants of a violent fight lie all around you, whomever used to belong to the wagon is no more than vulture food.  A bloody severed foot is here.

The area brightens.
[Spur Gateway.]

Travelers from Rathan to the northwest, and the Trade Route to the south, converge at Spur's west gate. Guards posted on the ground give those seeking to enter the city a cursory once-over. Their lack of interest shows that anyone approaching has already been observed from above for some time. A grate in the ground loosens mud from wagon wheels and hooves before they pass through the gate, helping to keep the streets of Spur fairly clean.  An open giant black iron gate, a giant green oak tree, a small blue pool, a thick oak grate over the pool, and a polished stone marker are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Gateway.]

The relative safety inside Spur is a comfort to those returning from the fields and mountains. To those leaving, a massive wall of defense around the city lies ahead. Archer towers beside the gate overlook the wall, offering a painful welcome to would-be invaders. Several guards on foot patrol pass and disappear behind a thick, bluesteel banded steelwood door. Wall road stretches to the south, a wide passage between the city wall and several large buildings.  An open iron gate, an open thick stone door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* south.

[Trade Way.]

From the city gate to the west, Trade Way continues eastward towards the busy Merchant district, past Joyeusse's Shop. The air is thick with the scent of fresh flowers. Wagons filled with goods bound for sale trundle past, their drivers hopeful of the anticipated profits. Eager young warriors venture towards the west gate and the dangers beyond.  An open carved rosewood door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Forsythia east...

[Trade Way.]

Deep grey mists surround a strange pile of rubble that lies south of the road. Occasionally a priest clad in a simple grey robe will wander past the rubble and whisper a short prayer under his breath. The fence running around the rubble is well kept, but the gate which once allowed entrance to this Temple has been chained closed.  A grey iron chained gate, a pile of rubble, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

[Trade Way.]

The throngs of travelers thicken as one heads east along Trade Way. An Anthian plays softly on a strange looking stringed instrument, her melodic voice filling the air. Judging by her clothing, and the number of silvers at her feet, she makes a fine living practicing her craft.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Forsythia east...

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

You follow Forsythia south...

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west. A shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

You follow Forsythia south...

[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Forsythia through an archway...

[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Forsythia through an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door...

[Bank.]

The quiet hum of business fills your ears as you enter the Market Circle branch of the Rasnian Bank.  A long wooden desk at the far end of the room contains many tellers waiting to help you with your banking needs.  An open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door and a bright wooden sign are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st governor's dread knight.
In the room are Genelyn the Secian (flying beside you), Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Dransillium the Draco, and Bant the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious exits: None.

l
[Bungalow.]

Thick plank floors are covered with a beautiful white and gold rug. Set upon the rug is a large overstuffed golden sofa. Threads of what look like pure spun gold run vertically throughout the sofa catching even the tiniest of light and reflecting it out to the walls of the bungalow. Behind a white slatted divider is a large bed, its white downy comforter falling to the floor. Beneath a large picture window that looks over the courtyard is a small wooden table with two chairs, perfect for a meal with a view.  A closed white pine door, a large comfortable bed, a closed gold-trimmed white walnut chest, a glowing crystal orb, and a white framed glass window are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Majestic Pine Lane, North.]

Set among the large pine trees are four small white bungalows. Each with a uniquely colored door. They are set in an "L" shape, two of them north of the road and two of them east, a mirror reflection of the bungalows to the south. In front of each home is a beautiful garden, created to reflect the personality of those who live within. A well manicured courtyard sits in front of the homes dotted with smaller pines and benches. Small rabbits hop along unmolested nibbling upon the lush grass.  A closed blue pine door, a closed tan pine door, a closed red pine door, and a closed white pine door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south* southwest*.

l
>[Bungalow.]

Thick plank floors are covered with a beautiful white and gold rug. Set upon the rug is a large overstuffed golden sofa. Threads of what look like pure spun gold run vertically throughout the sofa catching even the tiniest of light and reflecting it out to the walls of the bungalow. Behind a white slatted divider is a large bed, its white downy comforter falling to the floor. Beneath a large picture window that looks over the courtyard is a small wooden table with two chairs, perfect for a meal with a view.  A closed white pine door, a large comfortable bed, a closed gold-trimmed white walnut chest, a glowing crystal orb, and a white framed glass window are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
